subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Cole's Funny Picture Book
msgSnippet: Hi Paige, If you click on the Info button in QsConverter, I tried to summerize what you need to know to use the program.  To paste text (assuming you ve
messageBody:
Hi Paige,

If you click on the "Info" button in QsConverter,
I tried to summerize what you need to know to use
the program. To paste text (assuming you've
already copied it onto the clipboard), you need
to place the cursor in QsConverter's upper text
box, then enter "control + v", that is, hold down
the control key and then hit the "v" key.

Give that a try and see if it works for you... I
don't use WordPerfect, but if <ctrl + v> doesn't
work, let me know... if needed, I can explain how
you can make sure that the text you paste is free
of hidden formatting codes.

I've cut and pasted text from "MicroSoft Word"
with no problems; but I have occasionally run
across some web pages that have some hidden
formatting codes that QsConverter can't handle.

Jeff

--- Paige Gabhart <pgabhart@...> wrote:

> to: Jeff Smith
>
> Jeff:
>
> I downloaded your QS converter. I thought I
> had tried it before, but I
> couldn't find it on my computer. It worked for
> text I typed in, but I
> could not get cut and paste to work. If I
> copied something from a
> wordperfect file, I could not paste it into the
> upper segment of the
> converter screen. I tried right clicking in
> that box, and nothing
> happened and there is no pull down menu to
> allow one to choose "paste."
> What am I doing wrong?
>
> I agree with you. While it is necessary to
> learn to write phonemically
> in QS, I believe building reading speed needs a
> lot of practice, and
> using your converter would make that easy to
> come up with reading
> material. Of course, it helps if it can be
> pasted in as your suggest
> rather than having to type it in Roman first.
>
> I think we also should provide a number of
> short examples for group
> members to use as practice readings. If most
> of the people signed on
> this list, would download your converter, pick
> out a brief passage which
> they enjoy, we could have quite a bit of
> reading material in a brief
> time. I would encourage everyone to do this.
>
> Paige
>
>

>

> Book", if anyone needs a

http://www.alibris.com/search/detail.cfm?bid=8337362799

Hi Paige,

If you click on the "Info" button in QsConverter,
I tried to summerize what you need to know to use
the program.  To paste text (assuming you've
already copied it onto the clipboard), you need
to place the cursor in QsConverter's upper text
box, then enter "control + v", that is, hold down
the control key and then hit the "v" key.

Give that a try and see if it works for you... I
don't use WordPerfect, but if <ctrl + v> doesn't
work, let me know... if needed, I can explain how
you can make sure that the text you paste is free
of hidden formatting codes.

I've cut and pasted text from "MicroSoft Word"
with no problems; but I have occasionally run
across some web pages that have some hidden
formatting codes that QsConverter can't handle.

Jeff
